ANNE BOWERS

@UUID[Actor.uEVpcUB6gMibHpEh]{Anne Bowers}

 
STRENGTH 3, AGILITY 5, WITS 4, EMPATHY 3
HEALTH:  3
SKILLS:  Observation 2, Comtech 2, Command 1, Piloting 2, Mobility 1
TALENT:  Full Throttle
GEAR:  Hazmat Suit (Armor Rating 1, Air Supply 3).
 

PILOT, UNCSS TYPHOON

Courageous, spirited and optimistic, Bowers is relieved that rescue is on its way.  However, she is concerned for the safety of her husband, Captain Leland Barton.

 

ARZU

Arzu was once an Engineer staging post, a hub for vessels traveling across this sector of space.  As such it was an obvious place for the Perfected to concentrate their efforts, in the hope of taking control and infecting ships as they passed through.  The Engineer facilities were concentrated in the northern hemisphere, now lost under the Perfected's living Proto-Hive.

Lifeboat Two landed in a ravine within the equatorial region, three kilometers south of the leading edge of the Proto-Hive infection.  Here, the hive has consumed a number of Engineer Juggernauts that now litter the landscape as huge mounds of earth and seething Proto-Hive matter.  At the edge of this dreadful landscape there is a partially consumed Engineer Juggernaut, covered in Proto-Hive tendrils, plant matter and earth.  Its two enormous prongs are simply bulges under the earth, but the flat end of the ship remains exposed.  The lifeboat's emergency beacon is active but weak, and once the PCs are in orbit they can home in on it.  Once within 20 km, a COMTECH roll will detect weak PDT traces of the remaining crew—these are too weak to pinpoint their exact location but can track them to within about 100 m:

  • Captain Leland Barton — alive, located three km north of the lifeboat
  • Counselor Gráinne Shields — alive, located with the captain
  • Security Officer Azad Rukmini — alive, located with the captain
  • Navigator Petronella Edouard — deceased, at the lifeboat
  • Prospector Sargis Narene — deceased, at the lifeboat
  • Scientist Ji-Hye Suk — deceased, at the lifeboat.
THE HONEY TRAP

The Perfected have lost their patience with the Children of the Two Divines and their failure to acquire a ship that can take them to the Middle Heavens.  They have decided to allow the humans to learn of their false plan to use the Engineer Lychgate to make that journey.  This is the honey trap—the lure to bring the humans to the Lychgate, where the Perfected will spring their surprise and capture all the ships they need.  But they can't make it seem too easy—can't just give the humans the data—for they must not smell a rat.  After all, only one of the PCs needs to make it back with the information.

LIFEBOAT TWO

This has the same layout as Lifeboat One.

The main airlock door stands open, and the power is on.  The lifeboat has been badly damaged by its emergency landing and inside is a shambles.  There are few supplies left scattered among the debris, but the MedPods still work.  Communications are dead, except for the automated emergency beacon.

Outside the lifeboat, tracks lead north, towards a rising ridge of earth covered in plant growth and the gray-black-crimson of the Proto-Hive.  If the PCs check, and succeed with an OBSERVATION roll, they can see there are eight sets of tracks heading north (the surviving crew and devotees of the Children of the Two Divines).

MEDPOD 01

The Typhoon's Navigator, Petronella Edouard, is here.  She has suffered terrible injuries from the crash and is dead.

FOOD STORES

The bodies of Sargis Narene and Ji-Hye Suk have been dumped here.  Both have terrible wounds and lacerations.  With a successful MEDICAL AID roll the PCs can see their fatal injuries are stab wounds, and not caused by the crash.

THE ENGINEER JUGGERNAUT

This ship has been here for thousands of years.  The Engineers who were intending to flee from the Perfected realized they could not escape infection and chose to sacrifice themselves rather than risk spreading the plague further.  Over the millennia, the Engineer ship has corroded and worn away, only a shell of it remaining underneath the earth and Proto-Hive matter.  All the tunnels have tendrils running through them, and there is a Nodule in every zone (Proto-Hive Node).

APERTURES

These oval openings are five meters wide.  None appear to have any kind of door or bulkhead.  Those on the lower level can be accessed with a bit of nimble footwork, but those on the upper level are 20 meters off the ground and require a MOBILITY roll with a -2 modification to access.  The successful use of an ASSO-400 Harpoon Gun or similar equipment will remove that negative modifier.

LOWER LEVEL

ATRIUM CAVERN

A cavern formed by years of matter accumulating around the decaying ship, held in place by the Proto-Hive.  On all sides the walls are recognizable as the outer shell of an Engineer Juggernaut.  Where the hull has fallen away, mounds of debris have gathered.  To the north end, the Proto-Hive matter continues to encroach, filling the space.

The cavern is only illuminated by a fire in the middle, that casts a weak orange glow.  Three figures sit around it—two devotees and Azad Rukmini.  Rukmini has been separated from the other survivors as he chose not to join the Perfected.

READY ROOM

Full of racks that reach from floor to ceiling, this area is a warren of twisted structures and ornate scaffolding.  Captain Barton and Gráinne Shields are here, guarded by @UUID[Actor.qku8QucVd2DDvoSQ]{Mother Ma'kayla} , four @UUID[Actor.w3ayGlcL7p7l7z28]{Devotees} , and two Stage IV Aethon XX033 @UUID[Actor.zX8xCDBLsvOWcWW1]{Deacon (BBW)} .  They are waiting for the PCs to arrive and for the Perfected to make their move but will challenge the PCs if they come here.

CARGO 1

These long chambers have floors recessed three meters down, with ribbed, almost organic girders running from side to side.  Within the recess, a layer of mist, two meters deep, casts a sheen across the whole room, catching the ambient blue glow and making a beam that lies across it.  Beneath the beam, in the mist, rest hundreds of withered but serene Engineer bodies, laid out in disciplined rows.  If the PCs touch the mist they receive a mild electric shock from it, and a gentle musical note from nowhere plays out across the chamber.

The mist is thick and sweet smelling, but any PC submerged within it suffers from Severe hypoxia (Conditions).  An OBSERVATIONll allow the PCs to conclude this is what killed the Engineers, and—by the way they are set out—they willingly took their own lives.

CARGO 2

Filled with empty racks for steatite ampules, enough space for tens of thousands.

OVERSEER'S BAY

There are twelve panels spread across this chamber, each with a seat, a harp-like structure built into the top, and white fleshy controls.  If the PCs wish to activate them, they need to succeed at an OBSERVATION roll followed by COMTECH.  This activates a hologram that plays out before the PCs—see the sidebar The Last Dance of the Engineers.

BOMB BAY

The floor of this chamber is an open 30-meter-wide iris value, revealing a five meter deep pit with the bottom covered by Proto-Hive tendrils.  Above this is a suspended bomb rack, holding hundreds of steatite ampules.  These contain the black goo—the 26 Draconis strain.  They are out of reach, but it is possible to knock one loose—the PCs will need to use their imagination to get to one.  Once loose the ampule will fall into the central pit.  Roll a Stress Die—on   the ampule shatters splattering black goo.  Anyone within ENGAGED range must make a Sickness Roll against Virulence 6 or become infected as a Stage I Abomination Stage I: Pathogen Carrier “The Tainted”.

POWER CHAMBERS

Very warm and vibrating with the hum of energy.

MAKESHIFT CAMP

This chamber has been set up as a camp for the devotees of the Children of the Two Divines.  There are six sleeping rolls, bags and stools, portable stoves and boxes of prefab meals.  Hidden amongst all this are D6 doses of Hydr8tion and Naproleve.

THE 26 DRACONIS STRAIN @DRAW[RollTable.gfrEUVcYSdIFCich]{THE 26 DRACONIS STRAIN}

If a PC becomes infected by the black goo or through the touch of an Abomination, they are in deep shit.  The only chance they have is to ingest or inject another dose of the 26 Draconis strain.  If they do this, they still have little hope.
They must make a STAMINA and then add the number of   to a D6 roll:

  D6
+MOD		   EFFECT
  1-4   The PC feels strong for a moment, but it's a false hope.  The black goo starts a rapid conversion of their DNA.  Their bodies bubble and burst in a welter of black gore.  They die.  All who witness this gain +1 STRESS LEVEL.
  5   The PC convulses for three Rounds as the black goo accelerates the transformation—then they immediately evolve into the next stage of Abomination. All who witness this gain +1 STRESS LEVEL and must make an immediate Panic Roll.
  6   The infection is slowed but not cured.  The PC will feel better, but their doom is still assured.  However, the infection is dormant for four Shifts, but then continues to consume the PC as normal.
  7+   The infection is halted, and the PC will survive.  However, they have forever been tainted by the 26 Draconis strain—how will this affect them in the future?
THE LAST DANCE OF THE ENGINEERS

The room is suddenly awash with bright blue light, a billion pixels flooding your senses.  They swirl then fall like snowflakes, resolving into images of huge humanoids, coming from all directions.  An endless stream of people, alien people, filling the chamber then running down one tunnel—running towards the huge cathedral of a room, with a recessed floor and row upon row of ribbed structures holding it together.  They seem to know where to go.  One by one, ten by ten, they reach a spot and calmly lie down.  Some signal to others, seeming to wave, while some hold a forearm or touch the shoulder of a…what? Companion? Friend? Crew mate? But within a few moments they all—hundreds of them—lie back and place their hands across their chests, in resignation, in peace, in finality.  Then the blue pixels flash and die, one by one, and before long they are all gone.

AZAD RUKMINI

@UUID[Actor.uokNZKpuBEgeSPWl]{Azad Rukmini}

 
STRENGTH 5, AGILITY 3, WITS 4, EMPATHY 3
HEALTH:  5
SKILLS:  Close Combat 2, Observation 2, Mobility 2, Ranged Combat 2
TALENT:  Bodyguard
GEAR:  M3 Personnel Armor (Armor Rating 6).
 

SECURITY OFFICER, UNCSS TYPHOON

Frightened and pessimistic but not willing to go down without a fight, Rukmini has refused to join the Perfected.  He has been given time to reconsider his decision.  He doesn't know where Barton and Shields are.  He will risk his life to save the PCs, given the chance.

 

LELAND BARTON

@UUID[Actor.JwXKhfChvJxcOE0l]{Leland Barton}

 

CAPTAIN, UNCSS TYPHOON AND STAGE I PATHOGEN CARRIER

Grief-stricken and hopeless, Barton sees no way forward other than to seek Perfection.  He believes his wife, Ann Bowers—a security officer aboard the Typhoon—is dead, and in his desolate weakness, agreed to join the Perfected.  Now that he is infected there is no turning back.  If a PC touches him, they must make a Sickness Roll against Virulence 6 or become infected as a Stage I Abomination Stage I: Pathogen Carrier “The Tainted”.

 
STRENGTH 4, AGILITY 3, WITS 4, EMPATHY 4
HEALTH:  4
SKILLS:  Stamina 2, Close Combat 1, Piloting 2, Command 3, Manipulation 3
TALENT:  Born Leader
GEAR:  Torn flight suit.
 

GRÁINNE SHIELDS

@UUID[Actor.z4m9Qizjpz7AnqcU]{Gráinne Shield}

 

COUNSELOR, UNCSS TYPHOON AND STAGE I PATHOGEN CARRIER

Resolute, stubborn and ready to die to stop the Perfected, Shields has pretended to go along with them.  She can feel the infection within her and knows it can't be good.  When the Perfected were playing the Navigation Orrery she secretly recorded it on a data pad she has hidden within her suit.  She will pass the data pad to a PC (this is the fifth campaign clue) and create a diversion to allow them to escape.  She doesn't realize this, but in passing the data pad on, the PC receiving it must resist the infection (Virulence 6) she—as a Pathogen Carrier—unknowingly is contaminated with it.

 
STRENGTH 2, AGILITY 4, WITS 4, EMPATHY 5
HEALTH:  2
SKILLS:  Observation 3, Medical Aid 2, Manipulation 3, Mobility 1
TALENT:  Flyweight
GEAR:  Protective suit (Armor Rating 2), data pad.
 

UPPER LEVEL

STASIS CHAMBER

A darkened room with row upon row of Engineer cryosleep beds, across the floor and running up the walls.  They are all empty.

ACCESS CHAMBER

Tunnels in the floor of this otherwise spartan room lead down into Cargo 1 on the lower level.  If a PC is running through this space, they must make an OBSERVATION roll to spot and avoid the tunnels.  If they fail, they tumble through, suffering five points of damage reduced by one per   on a MOBILITY roll.  They end up under the mist in Cargo 1.

THE CHORISTRY

Rows of concentric terraces lead down to a recessed stage in the center of the chamber.  On this stand rest a weird variety of gongs, pipes, and cymbals with various mallets for striking.  If one is played the melodious sound echoes around the ship time and again.  The music is so melodious that playing one of these causes the Engineer Perfected to momentarily remember their former lives, and pause for a full Round, taking no action.

SACRED CHAMBER

This chamber appears featureless and empty until the PCs look up.  The ceiling is the Sistine Chapel in hell.  Carved figures writhe in terror or agony, beastly talons and jaws strain to tear themselves free from the hull and fall upon the unwary.  It's such a sight that all viewing it gain +1 STRESS LEVEL.

STEAM ROOMS

Filled with mist and steam, visibility in these chambers is reduced to SHORT range.  They are also hot—for every Round after the first in here the PCs suffer heatstroke (Conditions).

POWER CHAMBERS AND DRIVE CHAMBER

Ornate structures weave and wrap around these rooms, and hum with restrained energy.

VIEWING ROOM

The two Engineer Perfected are here, using their telepathic abilities to monitor the PCs' progress through the Juggernaut.  Once the PCs have delved deep enough into the ship—and at a time of your choosing to best enhance the excitement—they will act.  See the event Join Us.  Part of the ship's structure has decayed away, and the Perfected can access the atrium cavern or the Navigator Orrery from here.

NAVIGATOR ORRERY

The chamber is dominated by the raised navigation dais in the center of the room and the orrery holograms that swirl and dance above it.  Central to this display is a mottled gas giant orbited by a four-sided, almost circular structure, with an immense outer ring connected to a central hub by spiraling booms.  The outer ring has four great hangars, and the central hub is a massive flattened sphere seemingly fashioned by the hands of the gods themselves. It spins in breathtakingly elegant laziness.  It is the Lychgate.  This is the fifth campaign clue (Clue #5—Interpretation Of The Hologram Orrery).

EVENTS

DON'T IGNORE THE JOES

Shortly after the PCs have boarded the UNCSS Typhoon, they will be met by the ship's Working Joes—Jake and Elwood.  They challenge the PCs, saying they are unauthorized personnel and must leave the ship immediately.  They will follow the PCs, repeating this challenge, and—if the PCs do not leave—will wait for a suitable moment, then attack the intruders.

SHIELDING HER FRIENDS

Once the PCs have entered the Engineer Juggernaut and made enough noise to alert those already inside to their presence, Gráinne Shields acts.  She knows the PCs are walking into danger.  She shouts a warning and tries to reach them, although a nearby Deacon will attempt to stop her.  She will fight to reach them and hand over her data pad.

THE TRAITOR

While the PCs are inside the Engineer Juggernaut, Leland Barton approaches them or allows himself to be found and rescued.  However, it is a ruse.  He wants to gain the PCs' trust and help them escape, so he can take over the Solovetsky Island and bring it here for the Perfected.  Despite his infection he still looks human, albeit a little unwell.  He will pass it off as the stress of the situation.  A successful MEDICAL AID roll will diagnose he is suffering from the Abomination pathogen, and he is highly infectious.  If at any point a PC mentions Barton's wife and that she is alive he will break down, and—if the PCs succeed at an opposed MANIPULATION roll—tell them the truth.  He will then do all he can to help them escape.

STALKING DEACON

As the PCs explore the Engineer Juggernaut, a Deacon is nearby.  It does not intend to attack, but is tracking the PCs' movements, so they can be trapped at the right moment.  Enter stealth mode.

JOIN US

The Perfected move to intercept the PCs, sending a telepathic wave of positive emotion and images of warmth and satisfaction.  The PCs' minds are flooded with images of love, togetherness, and the wonder of the universe alongside images of being trapped.  They say:

“Join us and experience Perfection.  There is nowhere to run to, and no way out.  Gift us your ship and you will be honored among us.”

The PCs must make an Empathy test, attribute only—if they fail, they must make an immediate Panic Roll, if they succeed they gain +1 STRESS LEVEL.  The Perfected start the hunt for the PCs, sending Mother Ma'Kayla, her devotees and three Deacons to track them down.

FINALE

Once the PCs reject the Perfected's offer to join them (above), the Perfected have every intention of letting at least one escape, but capturing or killing some of the others, to make the escape look genuine.  Both Perfected will chase them down, along with Mother Ma'Kayla, four devotees, and three Deacons, using telepathy and voiced shouts of: “You cannot escape, submit to perfection!” They will try to trap the PCs, shepherding them through the Juggernaut but eventually allowing them to escape.  

But it will be a tough chase, and not every PC may make it out alive.

EPILOGUE

The coordinates data for the Lychgate will take time for DA/UT/UR to decode.  How long will depend on where in the campaign you run this expedition.  The coordinates should become available at the end of the campaign, to allow the PCs to race to the Lychgate for the campaign finale.  Following this story, the PCs could recommend and be involved in the colonization of Azizo, or advocate for the destruction of Arzu using the UNCSS Ìyánlá's stocks of terraforming nukes.

METAPUZZLE CLUE #5—INTERPRETATION OF THE HOLOGRAM ORRERY

  • The Engineer structure—the Lychgate—orbits a super gas giant.  The Orrery data provides spatial coordinates but to decode, analyze and identify where the data refers to will require the processing power of DA/UT/UR aboard Solovetsky Island.
  • Arzu, the moon of KOI-2702.07, the gas giant called Palmyra, is highlighted on the Orrery.  An interstellar trajectory between it and the Lychgate has been calculated and overlaid on the projection.
  • Engineer hieroglyphs float within the stars and systems.  Translation:
  • —THE LYCHGATE IS OUR HOPE OF A FUTURE—ITS LOCATION TO BE PROTECTED FROM OUR CHILDREN—ACCESS TO THIS INFORMATION MUST BE WITHHELD—

The aftermath depends on the outcome of the Battle of the Ìyánlá.

The worst, for humanity's sake, is the Perfected win.  They take their contagion on their captured ships and head for the Middle Heavens.  The survivors from the Battle of the Ìyánlá have a choice.  They can flee into the Far Spinward Colonies with whatever strength they can muster, and start life over, but with the Sword of Damocles hanging over their head—waiting for the day when the Perfected, or the Xenomorphs, or the Engineers return to wipe them out.  Or they can race home, to call upon the fighting forces of the 3WE, the UPP and the USCMC to put aside their differences, to stand and confront this threat, starting a new story— a new campaign—as humanity fights back.

However, the Battle of the Ìyánlá may not be so cut and dried—a victory for humanity but the dregs of the Perfected remain.  Ìyánlá is infected so severely by the Perfected it cannot be recovered.  The survivors rush to evacuate all they can from the great ship, before plunging it into the heart of a nearby sun and finding somewhere to settle.  The old and established colonies would surely welcome them, or new colonies just starting up that could use their skills.  But the Perfected are still a threat, and there are many stories to be told of hunting them down and incinerating every last scrap of infection.

And the best—the Perfected are annihilated, their ships destroyed and the Children of the Two Divines dead or scattered.  There are still worlds to scour clean but without ships the ragged Perfected that remain are impotent.  The survivors can look to their future, complete the survey of the Far Spinward Colonies, and set up home, perhaps on a pristine world, untouched by either human or Perfected hands, and start a whole new story of exploration and colonization.

But the Lychgate still remains, enigmatic and with its deadly cargo.  Weyland-Yutani won't be letting this go, and neither will the other corporations wanting their cut.  The United Nations, under the authority of Governor Abantu, places a quarantine around it, but how secure can that be? But for now, as everyone licks their wounds and collects their wits, it holds.  And the Empress and her children, with timeless patience, grow into their new empire, and wait.

name: 10.02 TO GO MY OWN DARK WAY

pages.name: 10.02 TO GO MY OWN DARK WAY

text.content:
“We are all like the bright moon, we still have our darker side.”
—KAHLIL GIBRANI

The PCs find a primitive colony that has reverted to corporate authoritarianism to survive—a group of cliff-dwellers protecting themselves from those who turned feral and prowl the jungle floor.  The PCs find simmering class tensions, deadly dangers in the jungle and a group of refugees from the Children of the Two Divines.  The PCs must preserve the colony and protect the survivors, before Mother Ma'Kayla of the Children of the Two Divines arrives and demands the return of her wayward devotees.

WHAT IS GOING ON?

KOI-784.01 is a world of tropical jungles and mesas, with staggering cavern systems that fan out across the world.  The rich mineral prospects offered by these caverns were so enticing it was inevitable a colony would be established.

At its height, Dylan Colony was a thriving community of 40,000 people.  It struggled with the Isolation, and organized society finally collapsed 40 years ago.  Many people dispersed into the jungle to fend for themselves, becoming feral in order to survive.  Others, under the last remaining vestiges of Weyland Corporation authority, clung to civilized ways from the safety of towering plateaus, but living in constant fear of the ferals.

Since then, the cliff-dwellers have developed a quasi-corporate hereditary dictatorship, under the descendants of the Weyland Corporation executives—a board of ten led by three chief executives presiding over several hundred workers.  These Weylanders live a life of relative luxury, keeping control through possession of the few weapons that still work, but simmering resentment lies just under the surface.

The ferals number in the hundreds and had been flourishing on the jungle floor, living within the still-functioning atmosphere processor, occasionally raiding the plateaus for fresh meat.  But the processor is slowly killing them.

Some years ago, in an attempt to kill the ferals without a fight, the Weylanders deliberately tampered with the atmosphere processor, setting it to release low levels of phosgene gas.  Denser than the air, this poison has been building-up on the jungle floor, gradually throttling the life from the ferals.

Two months ago, a Heliades-class J ship crashed in the jungle.  Twenty former devotees of the Children of the Two Divines, fleeing the cult, begged for asylum.  Suspicious of these outsiders, the Weylanders nonetheless gave them sanctuary in a small, tented camp on a promontory called Judgment Bluff.  They were given basic shelter and food but were not trusted.  The refugees, grateful for a place to live, have been content with their situation, so far.  They are mindful of the Ovomorph they know is in the hold of their crashed ship but have no idea what to do with it.  What they don't know is that Mother Ma'Kayla and the Children of the Two Divines have not given up their search to return their rebellious sheep to the flock.

THE SILENT KILLER

Mingled with the stench of the jungle, the smell of the phosgene is almost lost, but there is a lingering odor of musty hay that is a clue to its presence.  This can be detected with an OBSERVATION roll, and then identified as phosgene with a MEDICAL AID roll with a -2 modification.  A successful use of a Pups device (@UUID[Item.bJ65FWpzHIoosqsi]{"Pups" Mapping Device} ) will identify the gas.  For every Shift spent breathing this poison, a PC suffers Mild hypoxia (Conditions).

WHAT'S THE STORY MOTHER?

The PCs receive a video call from Gaius aboard UNCSS Ìyánlá.

“Dylan Colony, KOI-784,01.  Established by Eldridge Dylan Sanchez in 2059 to take advantage of planet-wide cavern systems that were ideal for mining operations.  Terraforming initially failed but was successful on a subsequent attempt.  In 2100, the population was 90,000, mostly mining interests producing gold, titanium, and hematite.  The planet is exceedingly hot and steamy, with daily temperatures reaching 48 °C.  Mountainous terrain, with ravines and thick jungle, reportedly suffers from electromagnetic storms and monsoon rains.  Gravity is Earth-like.  The day is 20 hours long.

That is all for Dylan Colony.  Remember our mission mandate and your responsibilities.  Your Colony Potential Report needs to cover the potential for future mining operations, the status of the atmosphere processor, any scientific research possibilities, and the usual ad hoc opportunities that you may uncover.”

 

CLUES TO THE
METAPUZZLE

The PCs can learn the second campaign clue (Clue #2—Mother Ma’Kayla’S Crumpled Letter) during this expedition, by gaining the trust of Chikondi Okafor and the refugees from the Children of the Two Divines and being given the letter to them from Mother Ma'Kayla or, if they side with the cliff-dwellers who want to execute them, the PCs can find the letter in Okafor's gear.  Alternatively, a copy of the letter can be found in the debris in the hold of the crashed ship.

 

DYLAN COLONY'S LONG DATA DISC

The long data disc for this colony was saved by the Weylanders when society collapsed and is kept in the chief executives' hut on the Enclave.

 
KOI-784.01
KOI-784.01 is hot and humid.  Daily temperatures reach 48°C and don't drop much during the night.  Dominated by mountains, ravines, widespread caverns and thick jungle, it suffers from frequent lightning storms, intense monsoons and banks of fast-forming fog.  The gravity is Earth-like, and the day is 20 hours long.  Alongside the risk of phosgene poisoning on the jungle floor, the PCs may suffer heatstroke (), at your discretion.  The colonists are acclimatized, and do not suffer from this.

The planetary map gives you all the details you need for KOI-784.01 should your PCs want to further explore or even colonize it, using the rules in the Appendix: Building Your Own Better World.

SOLAR SYSTEM
& COLONY RECORD

Dylan Colony

KICKING OFF THE ACTION

The action starts with the PCs aboard their SEV, in the air above the colony, scanning the scene.

There is little sign of activity from high orbit, but the PCs' flyby of the Dylan Colony site reveals much.  The atmosphere processor is still operating, but the electrical flashes and the plumes of smoke say it's not in the best working order.  All around it lies the colony, overgrown and deserted, although a few crumbled ruins still stand against nature's onslaught.

The jungle spreads in every direction, broken by imposing rocky plateaus.  At least 100 meters high and very nearly sheer, the jungle hasn't claimed these mesas, and most are bare—except for the few near the deserted colony.  Taking a closer look, the PCs can see that six of the plateaus are connected by rope bridges.  On those six stand rough buildings and tents, smoke rising from small fires.  And then they see people—lots of people—hurrying from their shanty shelters to look up into the sky, to point, to shout.  The PCs cannot hear what they are shouting.  It's impossible to tell if they are terrified, shouting threats or welcoming greetings.

LANDING

The only easy option to land is within the overgrown ruins of the old town, a few hundred meters from the occupied plateaus, requiring a PILOT test with a -1 modification.  There is not enough room to land on one of the occupied plateaus without blowing away the entire flimsy settlement, but they could land on an unoccupied plateau nearby, with a -2 modification to the PILOTING roll.  They would then have to climb down, of course.  A failed roll means the ship has landed heavily, taking D3 damage.

SHORE PARTY

The security officer, @UUID[Actor.Qda0NCvYqEZtOi7q]{Hamidah Amir} , recommends she accompanies the PCs planetside, as the primitive society might present a danger.  She will be overprotective and see danger in every shadow.

THE APPROACH

If the PCs travel through the jungle to reach the plateaus, they will be stalked by two ferals.  Enter stealth mode.

FIRST CONTACT

The cliff-dwelling colonists will suspect the PCs of being either devotees of the Children of the Two Divines or pirates on a raid.  A group of ten, including four guards, will warily approach the PCs, and challenge them to identify themselves and their purpose.  It's up to the PCs how they go about gaining the survivors' trust, but once they have it, they will be invited to speak with their leaders Vidan, Dzuma, and Yen.  They will be taken under guard to the roundhouse on the Enclave plateau, escorted up the hidden tunnel and through the settlement.  They get a clear view of this place and its people and the camp of the refugees.  As they pass here, Chikondi Okafor will attract their attention and shout for help.  Once at the roundhouse they are greeted by the three chief executives, the rest of the Weylander leaders, and Lespera.  Vidan will welcome them, explain the history of the colony, and ask for support and supplies to maintain their lifestyle, and weapons to destroy the ferals.  The NPCs will try to forward their own agendas.

THE JUNGLE

The jungle suffers from the phosgene gas—the closer to the atmosphere processor the grayer the undergrowth, the more brittle the roots and stems.  It is dense and stifling, and moving through it is hard work.  Any attempt to run requires a successful MOBILITY roll, or the PC catches on a root and falls prone.

THE FERALS

@UUID[Actor.xMy9gu0tiBfu9oDn]{The Ferals}

 

The ferals have lived like vermin for 40 years, following their instincts to survive.  They can't remember when the urge to eat flesh became so overwhelming that any flesh would do.  That so many were seduced by the same insanity made it more acceptable, and soon it became the norm.  Complete was their fall into barbarism.

The ferals are wild barbarians, the apparent evil nemesis in this story, but they are victims of the Isolation too.  The PCs can rescue them from their dark path and get them treatment for their psychoses.  Until then, the ferals will be immediately hostile but are weakened by the phosgene poisoning.  If a feral is captured, it may be possible to help them.  The PCs will need to make a successful MEDICAL AID roll with a -2 modification, and a Turn of psychotherapy, to make the feral cooperative and sufficiently trusting to allow the PCs to help them.  If not, they are too far gone, and will need restraining and full hospital treatment to have any hope of recovery.

 
STRENGTH 4, AGILITY 3, WITS 3, EMPATHY 2
HEALTH:  6
SKILLS:  Close Combat 4, Ranged Combat 3, Observation 4, Stamina 3, Mobility 4
TALENT:  Tough
GEAR:  Armor scraps (Armor Rating 2), Spear (Bonus +1, Damage 2, MEDIUM range), Knife, Tattered Rags.
 
 
FACE TO FACE WITH A FERAL

Beastly and savage, the feral moves with the graceful intent of a tiger on the hunt, their eyes sharp and reflexes at the ready.  With blood-stained teeth and cracked nails, scarred bodies, and ripped skin, they carry their wounds proudly.  They wear almost nothing, torn rags tied in haphazard knots, but always hold their weapons, their spears and bone knives, in readiness.  In that moment of calm, you see a flicker in their eyes, of recognition, of humanity?  And then they burst into action, stabbing, swiping, grappling, to snare another victim to be dragged screaming into the jungle.

 

WEYLANDER GUARDS

@UUID[Actor.RwEA3lfBgWrxuVjn]{Weylander Guards}

Workers are pleased to be given guard duty as it's better than the working life and want to keep it that way.

STRENGTH 4, AGILITY 4, WITS 3, EMPATHY 3
HEALTH:  4
SKILLS:  Close Combat 2, Stamina 1, Command 1, Mobility 2, Ranged Combat 2
TALENT:  Hard Hitter
GEAR:  Heavy batons (Bonus +1, Damage 1), M4A3 pistol (no reloads), Weyland Corporation protective overalls (Armor Rating 3).
 
 

VIDAN SIMENYA

@UUID[Actor.scRiWC5efqRSVLo1]{Vidan Simenya}

WEYLANDER CHIEF EXECUTIVE

Old, indulgent, and kind-hearted, Vidan has led the cliff-dwellers for years and enjoys the privileges his rank brings.  Sympathetic to Okafor and the refugees, Vidan wants them to be accepted into the community.  The other chief executives, Dzuma and Yen, disagree.  Vidan regrets they could never make peace with the Ferals, as there must be some humanity left in them somewhere.

He wants the PCs' help to make his community safer.  He will also ask if they know of the Children of the Two Divines, as he wants to convince the community to welcome the refugees.  Whatever the PCs say, Vidan will see the refugees as victims needing his help.

STRENGTH 2, AGILITY 3, WITS 5, EMPATHY 4
HEALTH:  2
SKILLS:  Observation 3, Stamina 2, Medical Aid 2, Manipulation 2, Command 3
TALENTS:  Counselor
GEAR: 

Walking stick, M4A3 pistol (3 reloads), fine garments with the Weyland Corporation logo.
 

DZUMA TIBANDI

@UUID[Actor.49jrVL5tGENy5NFA]{Dzuma Tibandi}

WEYLANDER CHIEF EXECUTIVE

Impatient, ambitious and bloodthirsty, Dzuma has long since decided she should be in charge.  The arrival of Okafor and the refugees, and now the PCs, has given her the opportunity.  She will try to get the PCs to openly decry the primitive state of their society and discredit Vidan.  She will also attempt to turn them against Okafor and the refugees, again in her attempts to supplant Vidan.  To entice them she will offer any assistance she can to help the PCs.

STRENGTH 4, AGILITY 4, WITS 3, EMPATHY 4
HEALTH:  4
SKILLS:  Ranged Combat 1, Close Combat 3, Observation 2, Stamina 2, Manipulation 3, Command 3
TALENTS:  Hard Hitter, Weapon Specialist (Knife)
GEAR:  Knife, .357 Magnum (1 reload), tattered Weyland Corporation overalls
 

LEONARD LESPERA

@UUID[Actor.dD9gbwEdEaaxB5Mf]{Leonard Lespera}

 
STRENGTH 3, AGILITY 3, WITS 5, EMPATHY 4
HEALTH:  3
SKILLS:  Heavy Machinery 2, Comtech 1, Medical Aid 2, Manipulation 1
TALENTS:  Spaceship Mechanic
GEAR:  Basic tools.
 

WORKERS' LEADER

Outgoing, caring but bitter, Lespera is the highly respected leader of the workers.  While he appears to support the chief executives, he is angry at their decision to tamper with the atmosphere processor.  It cost two workers’ lives to the ferals to do it, and the workers and jungle suffer for it.  He has been quietly stoking the growing resentment that is simmering against the Weylanders.  He genuinely likes Vidan and only this stops him rebelling openly.  If Vidan is removed from power or harmed, Lespera will start the revolt.  He wants peace for the people but will hint to the PCs that unrest is just beneath the surface.

 
 

YEN YAMADA

@UUID[Actor.neQVdbqpDtsoabd2]{Yen Yamada}

WEYLANDER CHIEF EXECUTIVE

Spoiled, vindictive and resentful, Yen wants to maintain the status quo but to rule alone.  She enjoys the rush of power, and neither Vidan nor Dzuma give her the respect she wants.  She sees the PCs as powerful allies and will promise them anything if they assist her in removing her rivals for power.

STRENGTH 5, AGILITY 3, WITS 3, EMPATHY 4
HEALTH:  5
SKILLS:  Observation 2, Ranged Combat 2, Close Combat 3, Manipulation 2, Command 3
TALENTS:  Quick Draw
GEAR: 

Knife, battered 37A2 shotgun (5 reloads), Weyland Corporation jacket.
 

CHIKONDI OKAFOR

@UUID[Actor.Aq92zAbY1BCDZ9a2]{Chikondi Okafor}

REFUGEE FROM THE CHILDREN OF THE TWO DIVINES

Selfless, hopeful but world-weary, Okafor cannot now understand how he was swept-up by the Children of the Two Divines.  He has not seen a Xenomorph, the “Angel,” although he knows the Ovomorph in his crashed ship has something to do with it.

He has witnessed the infection that the Perfected spread, not least in Mother Ma'Kayla herself, and all he wants now is a place to live in peace.  He fears Mother Ma'Kayla will come looking for them, and desperately wants to find greater safety—he sees the PCs as his way to achieve it.  Despite being under house arrest, he will attract the PCs' attention and beg for their help.  If the PCs ask about the Children of the Two Divines he will trade his knowledge of the cult, and the Ovomorph in his crashed ship, in return for help and protection.

STRENGTH 4, AGILITY 3, WITS 4, EMPATHY 4
HEALTH:  4
SKILLS:  Heavy Machinery 1, Comtech 2, Piloting 2, Medical Aid 2, Command 1
TALENTS:  Bodyguard
GEAR:  Small Knife.
 

MOTHER MA'KAYLA AND THE CHILDREN OF THE TWO DIVINES

Once the PCs have established themselves and searched the crashed Heliades-class J ship, they will hear another Heliades-class J vessel—this is Mother Ma'Kayla.  She has been hunting down Chikondi Okafor and the refugees, desperate to capture them alive and make an example by punishing them before the cult.  Tracking the ship's transponder, she finds Dylan Colony.

ARRIVAL

The PCs can see the ship circle the old colony and the plateau, before landing on a plateau to the north, near the location of the crashed ship.  They can't make out any more details, but Ma'Kayla and her devotees search the crashed ship.

CONFRONTATION

The PCs will be confronted by Mother Ma'Kayla and eight devotees, either at the crashed ship (if the PCs choose to travel to investigate the new ship's arrival) or at the Weylander plateau (if they choose to wait and see what happens).  See the sidebar Introducing Mother Ma'Kayla.  If the confrontation plays out on the Weylander plateau Chikondi Okafor will see Ma'Kayla and he and the refugees will try to hide from her view, terrified of being found.

Ma'Kayla will introduce herself and say she is searching for the crew (and cargo, if the PCs have taken it) of the crashed vessel, as they are friends, and asks if the PCs have seen them.  If the PCs deny any knowledge, or state the refugees are already dead, she will simply nod.  The PCs can tell she does not believe them with a successful OBSERVATION roll.  If the PCs admit to knowing of the refugees Ma'Kayla will demand that they be returned to her at once and threatens reprisals if the PCs do not comply.  

In the unlikely event that the PCs agree to hand the refugees over Vidan and the majority of the Weylander workers will vociferously disagree and prevent this from happening.

Once the confrontation reaches deadlock Mother Ma'Kayla will tell the PCs the matter is not resolved, they cannot leave without her permission, and her ship has orders to fire on the Solovetsky Island should it attempt to leave (her ship is a Weyland Heliades-Class J Sev vessel armed with three light railgun turrets and two Short Lance ASAT missile batteries—see Offensive Armaments in the core rulebook).  She and her devotees will return to their ship.

INTRODUCING MOTHER MA'KAYLA

Tall and lithe, Mother Ma'Kayla walks with graceful elegance.  But she isn't right.  Her head is slightly too large, swollen and distended, her arms and legs are bulky and just that little bit too long, her eyes don't look at you, they look through you.  Composed and sure of herself, she stops before you, an almost mesmerizing sight.  A slight smile plays across her lips.

THE CLIFF-DWELLERS' CAMP

The camp is ragged, with buildings made from rough-hewn wood and prefabricated panels and frames.  Tarpaulins keep the rains out.  Old and rusted tools lie alongside crude home-made replacements.  Each of the six plateaus has a giant wooden post projecting twenty meters into the sky—primitive lightning rods.  The people on the plateau are fearful.  Years living with the threat of the ferals, and the daily terror that they or a loved one might be dragged off to be butchered, have cowed these folk and made them timid.  However, the arrival of the PCs is an enormous event.  Everyone is cautious, yet curious to get a look at the newcomers.

THE CLIFFS

The cliffs are all sheer, and hard to climb even with proper gear.  Any MOBILITY attempt comes with a -3 modification, with +1 for modern climbing equipment.  Two successful rolls are needed to scale the cliff, each taking a Turn.  Any failed roll and the character plummets to the rocky ground, taking falling damage as normal.

ROPE BRIDGES

Twenty meters long and three wide, these bridges appear rickety—any PC crossing one for the first time must make a MOBILITY roll or gain +1 STRESS LEVEL for the experience.  But they are surprisingly strong, and will take 12 damage before they break, double damage from fire.  Anyone on one when it breaks must make a MOBILITY roll with a -2 modification to grab hold of something, otherwise they fall the 100 meters to the jungle floor below.

TUNNEL

The tunnel is the only easy way up.  The entrance is hidden by an outcrop of rock, requiring an OBSERVATION roll to spot from the ground, although it's easy to spot from the air.  If the PCs fail to find it, a party of cliff-dwellers will eventually make contact.

WORKERS' SHANTY TOWN

Only workers live here, a busy and smelly place with an ever-present sense of anxiety.  Small cooking fires fill the air with smoke as dogs and chickens run free and people move between the shacks and tents that make this place so crowded.  A huge mound of laundry sits next to the rain-filled pool, where the scrubbing workers sit up to their waists.  A guard makes sure no unauthorized folk cross the bridge to the Bluff.

BLUFF

A few senior workers live here, but it's similarly busy to the Shanty Town.

FARM

All the space here is used to grow food, with tightly packed crops in small plots.  A few chickens, sheep and goats are squashed together in rancid animal runs, and there is a sealed wooden Tarantula farm, a dangerous but delightful delicacy.

SHRINE

A large wooden gazebo, with a slatted wooden floor, dominates one end of this plateau, faced by a ring of huge stones.  The craftsmanship is much better than that found in the rest of the camp, and the stones have been roughly carved to resemble human figures.  It's uncanny, but the stone figures, as rudimentary as they are, all seem to be crying out in desperation.

The community will come together at the Shrine to decide the fate of the refugees from the Children of the Two Divines.  Vidan favors welcoming them as citizens, but Dzuma and Yen don't.  Dzuma wants to cast them out to fend for themselves, but Yen claims this will see them become ferals.  She demands their execution for the safety of all.  Okafor will plead for mercy, begging the PCs to intervene on their behalf.  If they don't, Yen wins the day, and the refugees will be thrown from Judgment Bluff.

NABO

The main trade and meeting plateau for the community.  Huts and tents hum with activity, from tanning hides, making spears and slaughtering animals, to weaving clothes, firing pottery and crafting crude jewelry.

MEETING HOUSE

A sturdy long-house with a tarpaulin covering the front to keep the rain off, a fire pit that fills the center of the house and furs and blankets lining the floor.  It is used by the chief executives as a meeting hall, court room, and feasting place.  The PCs will be invited to bunk down here during their stay.

JUDGMENT BLUFF

Fenced off from the rest of the Nabo plateau by a low wooden palisade, Judgment Bluff is the community's place of justice.  Below the twisted outcrop is a grove of plants that resemble giant bamboo.  Those guilty of any crime are thrown from the outcrop to their deaths on the stakes below, while the people watch.  There are some bones at the base of the cliff, but not many—before an execution, a guard blows a long wooden horn that emits a rumbling note, calling the ferals to a free feast.

REFUGEE CAMP

The refugees from the death cult live here, in tattered tents.  A guard always watches them from behind the palisade.

ENCLAVE

Grand and well maintained, with sturdy wooden buildings and better-quality furnishings, this plateau is the exclusive home of the Weylander board members. The chief executives live in the largest house, on the south-east facing cliff.  The colony's long data disc is here.  If the PCs analyze it they will learn the following:

  • Dylan Colony continued to function for nearly 40 years after the Isolation, although many people left.
  • Unrest and political infighting saw the society fracture in 2142.
  • 2144 the mining operations ceased and the facilities to the northwest of the colony were moth-balled (instructions to re-start the facility are recorded here).
  • 2145 civil unrest running riot and collapse of authority and civic control.
ROUNDHOUSE

This wood and stone building serves as the Weylanders' board room.  Any matters that require all the executives to contribute are discussed here.  When the PCs first arrive, they will be escorted here to receive the community's hospitality and speak with the chief executives.

THE CRASHED SHIP

The Heliades-class J vessel was badly smashed in the crash.  The top two decks are an unrecognizable mass of twisted metal and shattered trees.  Access to the ship can be gained through the torn hull on the lowest deck via the vehicle bay.  It's partly swamped with mud and earth from the jungle floor.  From there it takes an easy MOBILITY roll, with a +2 modification, to climb the catwalks to reach the cargo hold.

THE BRIDGE

This is hard to reach, needing a MOBILITY roll with a −2 modification to squeeze through the twisted wreckage.  Once reached the PCs see the systems are all destroyed, but it is still sending out a transponder ping.  They can turn this off.

THE HOLD

The hold is a shambles after the crash, with discarded baggage, shredded bags and papers scattered all over.  If the PCs search through the papers, they find little of interest except a copy of Mother Ma'Kayla's letter to her devotees, the second campaign clue (Clue #2—Mother Ma’Kayla’S Crumpled Letter).  There are also three small wooden crates.  One is empty.  The second has been crushed by a falling beam, the Xeno­morph egg inside it splattered and dead.  It's impossible to retrieve it but the PCs could take a sample.  In the third is a live Ovomorph—it's hibernating and does not immediately open (see the event Wakey Wakey).

THE ATMOSPHERE PROCESSOR

The automated processes that have kept this place running have been struggling for years, and it shows.  The rhythmic hum, hiss and clank of the machinery is not right, and there is no way to access the underground levels.  Any PC with the HEAVY MACHINERY skill will know that a major control hub should be located on Platform 13.

GROUND LEVEL

The phosgene is most concentrated here, and everyone breathing it must make a roll against its effects every Turn instead of every Shift.

ACCESS DOOR

This huge door, set into the floor of the processor, is open, revealing a 20-meter-deep pit that would normally be used to access the lower levels. However, it has long since been blocked off.  The pit has been used by the ferals to dispose of their victims—the bottom is a gruesome display of rotting humanity.  Anyone viewing this gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.

PLATFORM 13

The platform's southern side has a working control panel that will allow the PCs, with a successful COMTECH roll, to adjust the atmosphere processor's output.  The large service lifts on either side of the platform work, with access ladders alongside them.  

The ferals use this platform as a nest, as exhaust pipes constantly flood it with clean air.  It is a shambles, with shabby sheets on the floor and bones, sticks and spears littered all over.  At any time 15 ferals are here.  They will notice the PCs approach as they ascend to the platform, and will hide amongst the debris, pipes, and girders.  Enter stealth mode.  Once the PCs reach platform 13 they will see the overwhelming number of ferals, in a sudden and silent standoff.  All must make a Panic Roll.

As soon as a PC takes any action, or makes any sound, all hell breaks loose.  Five ferals attack, while the others flee, spooked by the invasion of their nest and shimmying down the beams and scaffolds.  They can be heard screaming and yelping as they escape.

THE MINING FACILITY

The facility was professionally moth-balled and remains in good condition.  The instructions to access and restart the facility are contained in the colony's long data disc.

EVENTS

IN A FLASH

The weather changes in a flash—literally.  Lightning strikes the ground or a wooden lightning rod on a random plateau.  Anyone within MEDIUM range suffers an attack with twelve Base Dice, Damage 1.  At your discretion this could set something valuable on fire.

ROLL IN THE FOG

Dense fog forms throughout the jungle, reducing visibility to SHORT range.  With the fog the sounds of the jungle are deadened.  An eerie silence descends, only broken by the occasional scrabble of something in the undergrowth.  Everyone gains +1 STRESS LEVEL.  This may be a good prelude to The Raiding Party event.

THE RAIDING PARTY

Suddenly from the jungle undergrowth the PCs hear war cries and yelps of excitement.  A party of four Tomogo have smelled them and want to snatch one of the group.  They start to hunt the PCs.  Enter stealth mode.  The Tomogo intend to use their tried and tested tactics—they will stalk closer before two will make a diversionary attack at the front, while two others will use that distraction to grab the tail-end charlie.

THE WANDERING CHILD

One of the devotee refugees, Valery Reina, desperate to get some goat's milk for her baby, sneaks out of the camp in the night and past the snoozing guard.  The PCs get an OBSERVATION roll to hear her as she crosses the Nabo plateau.  If they don't, or choose not to act, she will be caught on the Farm, creating a lot of noise.  She is dragged back by a guard and accused of stealing.  If the PCs don't intervene, Vidan will regrettably pass the death sentence on her, and she will be thrown from Judgment Bluff, along with the inattentive guard.

WAKEY WAKEY

The Facehugger in the Ovomorph wakes up and goes looking for a host at a moment when the PCs are nearby, to create the greatest tension or trouble.  If it is still inside the crate, the PCs will hear a scrabbling noise for three Rounds before the Facehugger bursts out.  If the egg has been removed from the crate, any PC within MEDIUM range can make an OBSERVATION test to see or hear the egg open.  At your discretion it may attack the PCs, or impregnate a nearby NPC.  The cliff-dwellers will not react well to this and may turn on the PCs as bringers of evil.

THE FERALS ATTACK

The ferals, agitated by the invasion of their nest by the PCs, have been yelping and calling in the forest, building for an aggressive assault on the cliff-dwellers.  Their calls can be heard coming from all directions and getting closer and closer to the plateau.  All who hear this gain +1 STRESS LEVEL moment of highest tension, they will appear at the base of the cliffs, and start climbing.  There are dozens of them.

THE WORKERS REVOLT

Tensions amongst the workers reach breaking point, as it's clear the executives are using the PCs to feather their own nests, while keeping the status quo.  Led by Lespera, the workers storm the Bluff and then the Enclave, to demand equality.  The executives will try to placate them long enough to get them back to the Shanty Town and defuse the situation, but—at your discretion—the angry mob can grab the leaders and throw them from Judgment Bluff.

FINALE

Mother Ma'Kayla's patience wears thin.  She contacts the PCs giving them one last chance to hand the refugees over.  Her ship fires a warning missile that just misses as a demonstration of her intent.  If the PCs refuse again, she says:

“I regret you have forced my hand and denied me my righteous retribution against my wayward children.  I have ordered my devotees to overload the atmosphere processor.  It will explode in three hours, with the force of 15 mega tons.  You will all die.  It is a pity, for you could have joined the Children of the Two Divines and lived your lives in the glorious pursuit of perfection.  If you attempt to leave, I will shoot your ship down.  If you wish to live, place the refugees, alone, on the plateau by your shrine—leave them there for us to collect.  Once they are aboard you will be free to depart.  Don't think you can repair the processor—

I have sent some friends to keep you occupied.”

Ma'Kayla has released two Stage IV XX033 Xenomorphs, @UUID[Actor.zX8xCDBLsvOWcWW1]{Deacon (BBW)}, to cause panic and fear at the cliff-dwellers' settlement.  They can be heard squealing in the distance.  Climbing the cliff is no barrier to these monsters and they will raid the plateau at a time to best enhance the tension.

It's up to the PCs how they want to resolve this situation.  If they rush to the atmosphere processor, they will have to cope with the ferals (although some are dead, killed by the Children of the Two Divines) and five devotees left behind specifically to prevent the overload being deactivated.  To deactivate the overload requires a HEAVY MACHINERY roll, and a Turn of work, followed by a COMTECH roll and another Turn of work.  If the PCs successfully achieve this the Solovetsky Island will come under attack as Mother Ma'Kayla tries to use force to recapture the refugees.

EPILOGUE

Once the dust settles, literally or metaphorically, there are still opportunities to re-colonize Dylan Colony, should the PCs want to press for that.  The Great Mother Mission's chief medical officer may be shocked by the reports of the ferals and proposes a mission to return to the jungle to find, capture, and treat those poor people, and welcome them back into civilization.  

But is there still a Facehugger running free?

METAPUZZLE CLUE #2— MOTHER MA’KAYLA’S CRUMPLED LETTER

“You don't understand—this place isn't what we thought it was.
I was wrong.  We were so wrong.”
—ELIZABETH SHAW

The Lost Worlds is a sandbox campaign for frontier colonists, set in the distant reaches of the Far Spinward Colonies.  The player characters—blue collar, salt of the earth, hard-working types—are part of an ambitious expedition in search of these colonies, lost nearly a century ago.  Their goal: to find them, make the people safe, re-colonize the sector, and bring it back into the embrace of human society.

But this campaign isn't just a colony mission, it's also about exploring alien worlds.  The PCs will discover the breathless wonders of the galaxy, and trade them in for enough fat Company dollars to retire on.

The campaign consists of six expeditions to different Far Spinward Colonies, which can be played in any order, and a seventh campaign finale.  There are also rules to generate encounters at any of the other colonies too.  As your PCs travel, they will learn clues about the terrible threats playing out across this space, leading them to the single-minded bio-mechanical organisms known as the Perfected, and their intent to remake humankind in their dreadful image.  They will reach the final climactic expedition where they must face this terror and decide the destiny of all.

THE FAR SPINWARD COLONIES

SETTLE DOWN FOR A HISTORY LESSON

By the 2050s the unfettered growth of the mega-corporations meant that private equity led the way to the stars.  The British Weyland Corporation established settlements in what became known as the Far Spinward Colonies, then brought them under the auspices of the newly formed Three World Empire. But while Weyland and the 3WE were the prime movers behind this expansion, the colonists themselves came from all walks of life, including the Chinese Asian Nations Cooperative (CANC), a supernation subsequently absorbed by the UPP.  All told, eighteen colonies were established, inhabited by millions of hopeful pioneers.

Then, 75 years ago—disaster.  The space between the Outer Rim and the Far Spinward Colonies was scoured by massive solar ejections, gamma bursts and waves of radiation.  The time known as “the Isolation” had come.  Travel was made impossible, and all communication with the new colonies was lost.  Cut off from the Middle Heavens, the Far Spinward Colonies were left to fend for themselves and forgotten.

Until now.  Looking for a common cause to unite the squabbling superpowers, the United Nations proposed a multi-national expedition, the Great Mother Mission, to unite humanity behind a common goal and reclaim the lost colonies.

FAST FORWARD TO 2185

Those 75 years have been tough for the citizens of the Far Spinward Colonies.  The radiation storms wreaked havoc, and the loss of their supply lines from home was a terrible blow.  Some colonies managed to hold on, re-focusing their efforts on just staying alive.  Others fell into barbarism and infighting. Some failed completely, leaving no survivors.

On top of all that, the colonists disturbed something that had long been asleep.  The Fulfremmen, aka the Perfected, had been hibernating, waiting to be found by living, breathing creatures so they could continue their one mission in life: to infect—to make perfect—everything they find.  Three colonies quickly fell to them, before the settlers could mount a resistance.  Some fell back to hide in their colonies or hold the line there.  Others took more direct action, to try and keep the Perfected at bay.

THE FULFREMMEN

The Fulfremmen are relentless in pursuit of two objectives—their need to spread their “perfection” to every living and mechanical entity they can, and their desire to cultivate an Empress hive of XX121 Xenomorphs, a “hive of hives,” as a sacred monument to the majesty of these creatures.

The Perfected were created by an advanced humanoid species known as the Engineers—Homo Gentior—who, in their attempts to recreate an ancient alien lifeform they called the Destroying Angel, also created humankind, the Arcturians and the Protomorph.  Despite their technological mastery the Engineers came into conflict with their creations—the Perfected persisted, the Engineers did not.

SITUATION: Asleep for millennia, the Perfected were accidentally awoken after the Far Spinward Colonies were isolated from the Middle Heavens.  Capelli, Kareti and July Colonies were overrun and transformed into Proto-Hives (The Living Proto-Hive).  Sanchez Colony was destroyed before they could transform it.  But the Perfected's ability to spread has been hampered by a lack of both navigational data for the Middle Heavens and spaceships with FTL drives that can cover the distance.  

One year ago, a congregation of the Children of the Two Divines traveled to the Far Spinward Colonies and found them.  The Perfected gave some the gift of perfection, but immediately saw the value in keeping others un-perfected, to use as moles within the colonies, to infiltrate them and search for a ship to help them fulfill their destiny.

The Children of the Two Divines also brought a gift: an offering of XX121 eggs.  The Perfected have been cultivating xenomorph hives ever since and nurturing an Empress to rule over them all.  The Perfected know of the Engineer relic they call the “Lychgate” and see this as the perfect place to establish this “hive of hives.”

PLAYING THE PERFECTED: The Perfected are above all motivated to spread their infection.  They are relentlessly seeking navigation data for the Middle Heavens, and ships that can cover the 30 parsecs to their destination (see the expeditions Against a Sea of Troubles and Let Sleeping Gods Lie, and the campaign event Wolf in Sheep's Clothing).  As the campaign develops, they become aware of the Great Mother Mission, and will use the lure of the Engineer Lychgate as a honeypot, to draw the colony ship UNCSS Ìyánlá to them, so they can capture it as a prize beyond their wildest dreams (see the expedition “In the Shadow of Perfection”).

THE CHILDREN OF THE TWO DIVINES

The Children of the Two Divines are all servants to the Perfected, and they work to further the Perfected's ambitions at all times.

SITUATION: Under the leadership of a rogue android, Mother Ma'Kayla, this extremist offshoot of the Church of the Immaculate Incubation (see Religion in the core rulebook) is nothing more than a starfaring death cult.  In 2185 they gathered Engineer star chart data, stole a fleet of modified Heliades-class ships, and headed for what their translations called “Perfect Space.” Expecting to find a paradise, they instead found the Far Spinward Colonies.  Now, their leaders have found perfection as bio-mechanoids, and their fanatical followers raid colonies to spread the word.  

Six of their Heliades-class vessels are still operational, but they suffer from a lack of spare parts and poor maintenance.  None has an FTL drive that is capable of anything more than a short haul among the Far Spinward Colonies, and their FTL rating is reduced to 20.

PLAYING THE CHILDREN: The Children of the Two Divines are fully committed to the objectives of the Perfected, while individual members work to prove their worth and be elevated to the ranks of the perfected.  In the campaign finale (In the Shadow of Perfection) they will fight to capture the UNCSS Ìyánlá.  

THE SCHISM IN THE DEATH CULT: Not all the Children of the Two Divines have proven devoted to the cause of perfection.  Six months ago, a group led by Chikondi Okafor realized the error of their ways and the danger they were in.  Taking one of the Heliades ships they made a run for it, reaching KOI-784 and Dylan Colony on their failing fumes of fuel, before crashing in the jungle.  Rescued by the colonists, they were soon recognized for what they were, or had been (see the expedition To Go My Own Dark Way).

GORHAM'S MARAUDERS

THE GREAT MOTHER MISSION

TIME FOR ANOTHER HISTORY LESSON

In 2180, the United Nations proposed that a multi-national, multi-corporation expedition should travel to learn the fate of the Far Spinward Colonies and reconnect them to the Middle Heavens.  Recession, and the recollection of the abundance in the old colonies, made this a mouth-watering prospect to the UA, 3WE, and UPP alike—the Great Mother Mission was established by the United Nations Interstellar Settlement Corps (UNISC), under the command of a UN bureaucrat, Governor Kholwa Abantu.  Naturally the Interstellar Commerce Commission (ICC) were to be well-represented, to ensure fair play and all safety protocols were stringently followed.

A colossal Deucalion-class colony ship—the UNCSS Ìyánlá—was launched in 2182, with its four Magellan-class support ships: the UNCSS Umsindisi, UNCSS Solovetsky Island, UNCSS Chimata-no-kami, and UNCSS Typhoon.  With the addition of three Throop Rescue and Recovery CM90V Corvus-class salvage vessels, the flotilla was ready to sail.

THE MISSION MANDATE

The United Nations Interstellar Settlement Corps' Mandate for the mission derives from the articles of the pan-national Great Mother Mission Accord of 2181, signed by all participating nations and agencies.

The mission parameters are as follows:

  1. Establish contact with the Far Spinward Colonies and provide immediate humanitarian support as necessary.
  2. Survey the sector and establish new UN-administered colonies.
  3. Recover existing colonial records for each colony, stored in local Long Data Discs.
  4. Negotiate terms under which surviving colonies should return to UNISC oversight.
  5. Assess the future technological, industrial, and financial potential.
  6. Adhere to all Interstellar Commerce Commission protocols and regulations and collaborate in the spirit of the greater good.
“GREAT PARTNERSHIP”

On the eve of launch, the Secretary General of the UN gave an address to the people of Earth:

“We are blessed, all of us here today, to see what humankind can do when we put our heads together in cooperation, rather than bang our heads together in confrontation.  The Great Mother Mission has brought about ‘the Great Partnership,' the partnership of all the supernations and mega-corporations, working together for the good of humankind.  Together you will find the lost colonies, restore their people, banish the isolation and bring our lost brothers and sisters back into the family of humanity.  The Great Mother Mission is a beacon of collaboration and friendship—an example to all of a better future, standing not arms versus arms, but arm in arm! Godspeed Ìyánlá!”

WEYLAND-YUTANI

The senior W-Y corporate on board is Director Kamal Vartouhi, but day to day running of Weyland-Yutani's affairs, and the colony ship UNCSS Ìyánlá, are overseen by a Platinum Edition reissue of the Walter series synthetic, called Gaius.

Most of the Far Spinward Colonies were established by the old Weyland Corporation and had fallen under the authority of the 3WE before the Isolation. Director Vartouhi naturally wants to see these outposts returned to the fold and ensure that Weyland Corporation's centuries-old investment finally pays off but is less concerned by this than the 3WE seems to be.

Vartouhi is even more interested in the other treasures that the Far Spinward Colonies may offer.  The corporation's generosity—contributing the MU/TH/UR 9000 mainframe for the UNCSS Ìyánlá as well as donating all four of the Magellan-class SEVs, each equipped with a DA/UT/UR 2200 FTL-linked back to Ìyánlá's MU/TH/UR—was not done from the goodness of their heart.  Through this network they can observe and eavesdrop on the activities of the whole expedition and ensure they don't miss any exciting finds (see the campaign event MU/TH/UR Knows Best).

UNITED AMERICAS

More than anything, the UA joined the expedition to keep an eye on their rivals, and now enemies, the UPP.  The news of the Frontier War back home has not immediately opened hostilities within the Great Mother Mission, thanks to the mediation of Governor Abantu.  But tensions are simmering and the UA leadership, under Valentina Berezi, keep trying to provoke the UPP into doing something stupid (see the campaign event Baiting the Bear).

COLONY RECORDS

Each settlement in the Far Spinward Colonies was set up with a recording mechanism called a Long Data Disc—a black box for the colony.  These recorded petabytes of data about all aspects of the colony, as well as the Command Team logs and reports.  Usually housed within a central Command Post, Administration office or Extrasolar Colonial Administration center these 50cm long black cylinders are fitted with a handle for easy extraction and mobility (heavy items).

THREE WORLD EMPIRE

The 3WE is focused on two things: bringing their former colonies back within the fold before they can be incorporated under the UNISC and keeping a lid on the growing support for the break-away New Albion Protectorate (NAPRO).  Under their mission leader, Colonel David Buston, they will jealously guard their interests as former overlords of the Far Spinward Colonies, and seek to suppress, and eventually crush, the NAPRO sympathizers within their ranks (see the campaign event Bring Them to Heel).

UNION OF PROGRESSIVE PEOPLES

The UPP, always wary, long suspected that the other nations were conspiring to exclude them from the riches to be found amongst the Far Spinward Colonies. To avoid that outcome their mission leader, General Nurlan Ozolinski, has taken steps to secure the new frontier for the UPP alone.  Two cells of six Ministry of Space Security (MSS) operatives have infiltrated the expedition's crew, to gather intelligence on the strengths and weaknesses of their rivals.  Additionally, they have infiltrated two platoons of Space Operating Forces, 60 soldiers, currently lying in cryosleep masquerading as colonists.

When the time is right, they will awaken these soldiers, and take the Great Mother Mission by force (see the expedition In The Shadow of Perfection).  But that is not all—the UPP secretly sent scouts, from its Cosmos Exploration Corps, in four fast ships ahead of the Great Mother Mission, to lay the ground for the UPP takeover (see the campaign event UPP Dead in Space and the expeditions The Devil Lives in Still Waters and In the Shadow of Perfection).

GENERAL NURLAN OZOLINSKI

@UUID[Actor.eqsWFMjtKUnnVzPh]{General Nurlan Ozolinski}

  Austere and haughty, but compassionate, Ozolinski is a career UPP soldier, having risen from the enlisted ranks to high command.  He knows that conflict is a necessary evil, but regrets that young lives must be shattered through it—he witnessed much death and suffering as a young SOF soldier.  He wishes that the Great Mother Mission could have progressed as a collaboration, but this will not stop him giving the order to take control (see In the Shadow of Perfection).  However, if the PCs can convince him of the threat presented by the Perfected (with an opposed MANIPULATION test) he will order his men to defend the UNCSS Ìyánlá first, before resolving the political infighting of the mission itself.

INTERSTELLAR COMMERCE COMMISSION

Laboring under the disdain of every space-faring organization, the ICC sees this expedition as the perfect time to re-assert their authority.  As such, the ICC inspectors are under orders from their chief, Superintendent Jim Busby, to get into everything being done by the expedition—they will be especially stringent about quarantine protocols for items or specimens that may be of extra-terrestrial origin.  They are going to make a nuisance of themselves and be a problem for any treasure-hungry PCs (see the campaign event Quarantine is Not a Dirty Word).

THROOP RESCUE AND RECOVERY

Throop Rescue and Recovery is a highly regarded private company under the leadership of Alecto Throop.  TR&R has been contracted by the UN to provide support operations as part of the Great Mother Mission and brings three Corvus-class ships at the expedition's disposal.  Throop answers to Governor Abantu.  TR&R can be called in to rescue the PCs should they become stranded (see the campaign event Throop to the Rescue).

Throop herself has had a long and exciting career.  Biologically in her 80s, she appears about 50 years old.  Many years ago, she had an encounter with the XX121 Xenomorph, something she will never forget.

THROOP'S NIGHTMARES

The PCs can learn much about the Xenomorphs from Throop, should they seek her help once they have come face to face with the space beast.  They will need to build a positive relationship with her, but once she hears they have encountered the beast she will offer guidance, at your discretion.  She will finish by saying:

“It is elegant, fast and terrible.  It exists to destroy and destroys to exist.  Once seen it will never be forgotten...”

THE MINOR CORPORATIONS

Hyperdyne Corporation (under Director Pereira Abrams), Omni-Tech Resources (CEO Kim Bak) and the Kelland Mining Company (Prospector General Lee Taylor) are all signed on for the Great Mother Mission.  They see this as the chance to elevate their companies into the big leagues and will scrabble for resource rights and contracts as hard as anyone.

THE NEW ALBION PROTECTORATE

Not officially represented on the Great Mother Mission, there are several members of the 3WE who openly sympathize with the New Albion Protectorate's position.  Led by the senior 3WE administrator Lynna Young-Hee, this faction gathers support as the campaign progresses, until the 3WE decides to put a stop to it with force (see the campaign event Bring Them to Heel).

RUNNING THE LOST WORLDS CAMPAIGN

The campaign consists of seven scenarios—six expeditions, playable in any order, and a climactic finale.  Outside of these, we are introducing a new concept to this campaign: campaign events.  Just like events in a Cinematic scenario, campaign events provide extra scenes and challenges for the PCs that can be placed into the campaign whenever you like, binding the overall story together and providing an exciting countdown to the finale.

THE METAPUZZLE: The campaign also presents a Metapuzzle for the PCs to unravel.  Each expedition (and some campaign events) offers the PCs the chance to find clues to that Metapuzzle which, by the end of the sixth expedition, will reveal the terrible truth of the Perfected's plans—what the PCs do with that knowledge is up to them.  Read more about the The Metapuzzle here.

HOW SANDY IS YOUR SANDBOX?

To make the most of the sandbox opportunities this campaign offers, you should allow your players as much latitude as possible to chart their own course through it.  If you are comfortable creating additional adventures or scenes, either in the margins of the expeditions, or for colonies that are not covered by the expeditions, your players will get the deepest and most rewarding experience.

The six expeditions include all the information you need on the planets the PCs will visit during those adventures, in case you or your PCs want to further explore, or even colonize, them.  The rules here, and in the Appendix: Building Your Own Better World, will help you create those adventures, and the planets and new colonies that feature in them.

However, don't worry if that's not your GM style.  The expeditions alone provide a full and exciting campaign—you will simply need to have the PCs directed to the appropriate colonies by a superior (either the UNCSS Ìyánlá's synthetic overseer, Gaius, or Governor Abantu himself).

RUMORS, HEARSAY AND GOSSIP

Aside from the Metapuzzle clues, there is other information the PCs can learn from almost any colonist NPC.  You should feel free to give out these details if the PCs have earned the information from an NPC or other source:

  • Since the Isolation, the colonies have fallen apart.  There has been little cross-colony communication in decades.
  • Some have chosen piracy, preying on the already weakened colonies.
  • An organization known as the Cooperative is the worst for raiding, kidnapping people and killing those who resist.
  • All told, many hundreds of thousands must have died.
  • The people of the Far Spinward Colonies are angry with Weyland Corp and the 3WE, as they feel they were deserted and left to rot.
  • Some colonies have fallen to some kind of pestilence that spread to more than one planet.
  • Some say that this pestilence is even worse, that someone out there is actively spreading it.
  • There were rumors of new ships in the sector last year, not from the colonies but from the Middle Heavens.

THE PLAYER CHARACTERS

In The Lost Worlds, the player characters are employees or contractors working on the Great Mother Mission.  They have a job to do, but will be able to choose where they go, what they do, and how they do it.  They will find the shattered fragments of former colonies, brave new worlds to explore and exploit, the remnants of an ancient civilization and the menace that threatens the safety of every human alive.

THE PCS' ROLE: The PCs are all members of the same crew, serving on the UNCSS Solovetsky Island, one of the mission's four Magellan-class J Science Exploration Vessels (SEV).  While the ship has an NPC crew that covers the basic roles needed on board, the PCs can play any role on the vessel they please.  Also, the game is at its most “sandboxy” if one PC is the ship's commander.  

PC AFFILIATION: Each PC will either be affiliated to a supernation or mega corporation, or be an independent contractor hired by the UNISC.  Either choose or roll on the table below to find out.  Don't worry if you don't like the outcome—your PC may be affiliated in a certain way, but it brings great roleplaying opportunities if they don't like it!

CONNECTION TO THE MISSION: Do the PCs have any connection to the Great Mother Mission other than the hunt for a great pay day? They will have their own Personal Agendas and may be die-hard supporters of one supernation or corporation.  But this is about their connection to the mission itself.  Roll on the table on the next page, or feel free to choose an option that is consistent with the PC's agenda and back story:

THE PCS' RESPONSIBILITIES: As a member of the Great Mother Mission, the PCs are paid to play their part in that mission.  They have a contract (Mission Contract) and need to follow it.  

EARNING A LIVING: In the multi-faceted conglomeration that is the Great Mother Mission, differences in currencies and payment traditions would have baked-in unfair practices and inequality of reward.  So, the UNISC adopted the Weyland-Yutani dollar as the mission's currency.  Weekly pay for your PCs, based on their roles within the mission, can be found under Work for Hire in the core rulebook.  Time in cryosleep is paid at a rate of one-quarter of the employee's salary per week.  

Taking account of the months in cryosleep this may feel like a lot, but it's small beer for being away from family and friends for years on end and facing the dangers of deep space.  The real money is made in bonuses earned for finds, resource claims and extra-curricular activities not covered in your basic contract.
